column4: I have this problem. I am using nvidia proprietary drivers but it doesn't show up in "Hardware Drives". When I turned to free ones I had one problem I don't remember but it rendered the system unusable. So, I get this black screen, and I go ctrl+f6, ctrl+f7 to get it back. This combination of steps are the only way I can get it back. The problem is that everytime I get it back it gets black again. And sometimes it goes away, sometimes not, then
I need to restart the computer several times until it stops.
I get a black screen. I can ctrl+f6, ctrl+f7 to get it back. Sometimes I need to restart the computer several times to stop it. How do I fix that?
no?
no!
accidental (??
lspci -nn | grep VGA
did you try and install the fglrx drivers? apt-cache policy fglrx | grep Installed
Installed: 2:8.723.1-0ubuntu6
your chipset is explicitly not supported.
I am going to pm you if it is ok with you and the mods to give you a number of commands to purge that and reinstall your drivers

you asked if you can do it with gnome on... I misunderstood your question... you cannot do it with gnome tools... but with gnome active is not a problem
correct
$ sudo rm /etc/X11/xorg.conf    rm: cannot remove `/etc/X11/xorg.conf': No such file or directory
sorry xorg.conf is old school as well... I am eating dinner
system seems faster. I hope I don't get more black screen of death.
